name: Hawaiian

dialects.name: Standard Hawaiian
dialects.notes: Modern standardized form taught in schools and universities

dialects.name: Niʻihau Hawaiian
dialects.notes: Only dialect with unbroken intergenerational transmission; preserves [t] for standard [k]

description: Hawaiian is a Polynesian language native to the Hawaiian Islands. Following severe decline after 1896 English-only education laws, it has experienced significant revitalization since 1978 when it became co-official with English. The language has one of the world's smallest phoneme inventories with only 8 consonants and 5 vowels (plus length distinction).
